intro: Tonningia barbata, commonly known as the hairy tonningia, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Piperaceae, which includes several species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically greenish-white and are borne in clusters. Tonningia barbata is often found growing in humid, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
